subSections.title: Compounds
subSections.text: {{zh-der|坐嘯|命儔嘯侶|呼嘯|嘯詠|嘯傲|嘯聚|嘯歌|吟嘯|狂嘯|櫳嘯|海嘯|海嘯山崩|蘇門長嘯|虎嘯龍吟|虎嘯|長嘯|龍吟虎嘯|虎嘯風生|虎嘯鷹揚}}

subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|うそ}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=うそ}}. Appears in [http://jti.lib.virginia.edu/japanese/manyoshu/Man9Yos.html#1753 poem 1753] of the ''{{w|Man'yōshū}}'', a poetry compilation completed around 759 CE, in the compound form {{lang|ja|嘯鳴}} (''usobuki''; see below).

subSections.title: Etymology 2
subSections.text:
[[File:Hyottoko-karlcow-wikipedia.jpg|thumb|250px|{{PAGENAME}} (''usofuki''): the “whistling” mask used in ''kyōgen'' performances.]]
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|うそふ|o1=き}} Compound of {{compound|ja|sort=うそふき|嘯|tr1=uso|t1=whistle, whistling|吹き|tr2=fuki|t2=blowing|pos2=the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|吹く}} ''fuku'', “to blow”}}.{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}{{R:Daijirin}}

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|うそふき}}

# the [[clownish]] “[[whistling]]” [[mask]] used in {{m|ja|狂言|tr=kyōgen|lit=crazy talk||a farce performed between [[noh]] plays}}

subSections.title: Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|うそぶ|o1=き}}
Originally a compound of {{compound|ja|sort=うそふき|嘯|tr1=uso|t1=whistle, whistling|吹き|tr2=fuki|t2=blowing|pos2=the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|吹く}} ''fuku'', “to blow”}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref> {{rendaku2|sort=うそぶき|fuki|buki}}
